title: 114_s3365
content: SECTION 1. TREATMENT OF PENSION AND EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLANS MAINTAINED BY TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include expanding the definition of qualified public safety employee to include Indian tribes and updating the definition of governmental plan to include plans established by Indian tribal governments. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to include Indian tribal governments in the definition of qualified public safety employee and governmental plan. This expands the scope to cover entities established under Federal, State, or tribal law wholly owned or controlled by these governments. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to include certain deferred compensation plans for Indian tribal governments, their subdivisions, agencies, and entities wholly owned or controlled by them. This amendment allows these plans to be treated as if established by an eligible employer under specific subsections. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 has been amended to include plans established by Indian tribal governments, their subdivisions, agencies, and entities wholly owned or controlled by them as governmental plans. Additionally, the Act has been amended to include tribal entities in the definition of a domestic relations order. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 has been amended to include plans established by Indian tribal governments, their subdivisions, agencies, and entities wholly owned or controlled by them as governmental plans. The amendment also includes tribal entities in the definition of a domestic relations order by inserting "or tribal" after "State" in the Act. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 has been amended to include plans established by Indian tribal governments and their entities as governmental plans. The amendments made by this section shall apply to years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
